Title: Doublepoint launches its WowMouse gesture-touch control app for Pixel Watch 2
Text:
WowMouse: Unleashing Gesture-Based Control for Android Smartwatches

In a world where technology is rapidly evolving, Doublepoint, a pioneering startup, has unveiled an updated version of its acclaimed WowMouse gesture-touch control app, exclusively for Android smartwatches. This innovative app, initially launched at CES in January, has gained immense popularity among Samsung Galaxy users, garnering over 30,000 downloads. Now, with its compatibility extended to Google's Pixel Watch 2, WowMouse is poised to revolutionize the way we interact with our devices.

The WowMouse app ingeniously transforms your smartwatch into a 'wrist-based' mouse, empowering you to effortlessly control a wide range of devices, including headsets, phones, tablets, computers, and more, using simple taps transmitted via Bluetooth to your watch.

Ohto Pentikäinen, the visionary founder of Doublepoint, shared his insights at the Four Years From Now section of MWC: "Gestures are the talk of the town, especially with the recent buzz around Apple Vision Pro. We see people making these intricate gestures everywhere! Our mission is to make these gestures invisible. We've developed discreet gesture detection algorithms that allow you to perform these actions seamlessly, even while your smartwatch is tucked away in your pocket."

The WowMouse app harnesses the subtle vibrations generated when your fingers touch each other to trigger its functionality. "These vibrations travel through the tendons all the way to your wrist, where our app, armed with an inertial measurement unit (IMU) and a gyroscope, ingeniously captures them," explained Pentikäinen.

Beyond its current applications, WowMouse holds immense promise for gaming and interactive experiences in the realm of augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR). Its intuitive gesture-based control could unlock new possibilities for immersive gaming and interactive apps on AR/VR headsets.

To empower developers, Doublepoint is offering preorders for its Evaluation Kit, a comprehensive package that includes a wristband, sophisticated algorithms, and evaluation tools. This kit enables developers to thoroughly test Doublepoint's gesture detection algorithm and integrate it into their creations.

With its updated version, WowMouse is poised to redefine the way we interact with technology, offering a seamless and intuitive control experience across a multitude of devices. Its potential to revolutionize gaming and interactive experiences in AR/VR is truly captivating.

Title: Samsung centers sleep with its first smart ring
Text:
In the realm of wearable technology, Samsung made a bold debut at MWC, unveiling its latest innovation – the Galaxy Ring. This ring marks Samsung's entry into the emerging smart ring market, a space that has seen growing interest in recent years.

The announcement of the Galaxy Ring sparked reactions from competitors in the industry. Oura CEO Tom Hale expressed validation for the category, emphasizing the drive to serve members and the community better. Circular's CEO, Amaury Kosman, welcomed Samsung's entry, viewing it as a positive step for the industry.

While some may view these reactions as mere platitudes, it's worth considering the significance of Samsung's entry into this market. The company's presence will undoubtedly impact existing players, particularly Oura, which has established a strong position in the smart ring category. However, Samsung's involvement also serves as a testament to the validity and potential of the smart ring market.

The Galaxy Ring's form factor limits its functionality compared to smartwatches, but it offers unique advantages. The ring's positioning on the finger makes it well-suited for tracking activity and sleep metrics, providing valuable insights into the wearer's overall health and wellness.

Samsung's Vice President, Hon Pak, highlighted the company's unique position in addressing fragmented data in the healthcare industry. The Galaxy Ring, along with Samsung's diverse connected device ecosystem, aims to simplify health tracking and offer a more cohesive platform for users.

The Galaxy Ring complements Samsung's existing health offerings, including smartphones and the popular Galaxy Watch line. While smart rings and smartwatches have often been seen as mutually exclusive, Samsung's entry into both markets could change this perception.

Samsung's focus on sleep tracking could be a key differentiator for the Galaxy Ring. The ring's design allows for comfortable sleep tracking, addressing a common pain point for many smartwatch users.

The Galaxy Ring is still in its prototype phase, with a release expected later this year. It will feature on-board sensors to measure heart rate, movement, and breathing, providing a comprehensive view of the wearer's health and sleep patterns.

Questions regarding pricing and battery life remain unanswered, but Samsung is likely aiming to be competitive with Oura's offerings. The possibility of a subscription-based service, similar to Oura and Fitbit, is also on the table.

Samsung's entry into the smart ring market is a significant development, validating the category's potential and challenging existing players. The Galaxy Ring's focus on health and wellness, coupled with Samsung's strong ecosystem, could make it a compelling choice for consumers seeking a comprehensive health tracking solution.

Title: MWC 2024: Everything announced so far
Text:
Mobile World Congress 2024: Unveiling the Future of Tech

The TechCrunch team is thrilled to bring you the latest news and innovations from the Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2024, held in the vibrant city of Barcelona. Get ready for a week filled with groundbreaking products, exciting announcements, and the unveiling of the future of technology.

Extended Battery Life with OnePlus Watch 2

OnePlus is making a bold statement with its upcoming Watch 2, promising a staggering 100 hours of battery life in full Smart Mode. This remarkable achievement is the result of three years of dedicated research and development in battery technology. Our very own Brian Heater had the opportunity to speak with Tuomas Lampen, OnePlus Europe's head of strategy, to learn more about the company's journey and how they managed to achieve such an impressive battery life.

Xiaomi's CyberDog: A Robotic Companion

After years of anticipation, Brian Heater finally got to witness Xiaomi's CyberDog up close at MWC. This robotic dog showcased its dressage shuffle and performed a captivating dance, reminding Brian of a scaled-down version of Boston Dynamics' renowned robot. Since its initial unveiling in 2021, Xiaomi has made significant improvements, including a more realistic head design. The CyberDog 2 is now available online for $3,000, double the price of its predecessor.

Lenovo's Transparent Laptop Concept

Lenovo unveiled a captivating laptop concept that will undoubtedly turn heads. This transparent laptop features a screen with a transparent pane, creating an augmented reality-like experience where graphics are overlaid on whatever is behind the device. While it's still a concept, Lenovo's creativity is sure to inspire future laptop designs.

Google Infuses AI into New Features

Google is making significant strides in artificial intelligence (AI) integration, introducing new features across its services. These include Gemini, an AI-powered messaging assistant, AI-generated captions for images, text summarization for Android Auto, and access to passes on Wear OS. Additionally, Google Messages will soon feature Gemini integration, allowing users to access AI-powered messaging capabilities within the app. Google is also introducing accessibility-related features, such as AI-generated captions for images with missing or inaccurate captions or alt text in the Lookout app.

DeepMind's Gemini: Unpausing Human Depiction

DeepMind founder Demis Hassabis discussed the recent pause on Gemini's ability to depict people. He revealed that the capability will be back online in the coming weeks. This decision was made after users pointed out that the tool was generating historically incongruous images, such as depicting the U.S. founding fathers as a diverse group of people instead of solely white men.

Seaborough's Innovative Mood-Enhancing Lamp

Seaborough, a Dutch company, showcased a revolutionary desktop lamp designed to improve mood. This small device mimics the sun's impact on serotonin production in the brain. It's designed to sit next to a computer or clip above a display, resembling an external webcam. Powered by USB, the lamp is still in proof-of-concept mode, but it promises to be a game-changer for those seeking improved mood and well-being.

Infinix E-Color Shift: Transforming the Back of Your Phone

Infinix is pushing the boundaries of smartphone design with its E-Color Shift technology. Building upon the e-ink screen work pioneered by Yota Phone, Infinix introduces color and a unique aesthetic to the back of the device. This innovative feature adds a touch of personalization and style to a part of the phone that often goes unnoticed.
